section.bdy:
Dosti Acres is a large residential complex constructed by the Dosti Group of
Mumbai , housing more than 1200 families. It is located at New Wadala,
Mumbai , which is the name given to that area in Wadala, which is predominantly residential.
History and Location
Wadala East was known to be a slum infested area with a scattering of oil tanks, warehouses, salt pans and burial grounds. However, starting from 2000, many real estate developers started purchasing land from the government and transformed parts of the area into lower to upper middle class residential areas. The construction of the
Adlabs Cinemas
IMAX
theatre and dome complex has also helped in starting the trend of residential apartment blocks at Wadala. Among the major residential complexes here are Bhakti Park, Dosti Estates, Dosti Acres and the two Lloyds' towers. Dosti Acres is located almost exactly at the infamous
Antop Hill
area. Coming from the
Dadar
or
Parsi Colony (5 gardens) side, one would pass the
Indian Oil Corporation tank and the Bombay Port Trust apartment block, then the Dosti Estates apartment block and finally reach this complex after climbing the Uphill Link road. The other gate of the complex opens out towards the Sion area.
Accessibility and public transport
The complex is 5 minutes away by car from both
Dadar
and Sion. There are many buses which ply along the wadala route -
Antop Hill
being a major bus stop. The harbour line also passes through Wadala, and is also 5 minutes away by vehicle from this complex.
The following bus routes can be used to commute to and from Dosti Acres.
9 ,67, 76, 88, 14, 15, 110 , 172, 341, 180, 181

Facilities
Dosti Acres has a podium structure. There is a Club House at the centre of the complex. The Club House also opens out into the podium. A swimming and a landscaped garden complete with a strolling path dominated the podium. 7 residential towers overlook the Club House and the podium.
There is a jogging track inside another landscaped garden near the Uphill Link road entrance.
